questions.question_text: Which type of design includes vendor models, host names, IP Addresses, port connections, logical unit number sizes, and number of CPUs? (Choose the best answer.)

discussion.content: Correct Answers: A, B (all the other have technology requirement in it)

The correct answer is AB.

The only Requirements are AB and they are non-technical. The rest are Constraints.

Selected Answer: AB
Correct Answer: AB

choices.E: Different vendors are used for the storage solution.
choices.B: The design should offer agility and freedom for application phases.
choices.C: All application servers have hardcoded IP addresses.
choices.D: Current business continuity and disaster recovery plans are based on tape technology.
choices.A: Any solution should add more value to current and future customers engagements.

questions.question_text:
An architect is helping an organization with the Logical Design of an NSX-T Data Center solution.
Which two statements should the architect consider as non-technical requirements? (Choose two.)

choices.D: Mix stateful and stateless NAT rules on the same gateway.
choices.C: DNAT should be applied on the uplink interface.
choices.A: An active/active model should be used.
choices.B: Use Reflexive NAT on the uplink interface.
choices.E: The high availability mode supported is only Active-Standby.

questions.question_text:
An architect is helping an organization with the Logical Design of an NSX-T Data Center solution.
During discussions about centralized services NAT running on Tier-1 or Tier-0 Gateway, the customer made these requests:
✑ Services contain stateful services.
✑ Services should be in high availability mode.
Which two selections should the architect include in their design? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
A,B wrong : statefull requirement
D wrong: can't mix statefull and stateless
answer : C,E

CE is the correct answer.

Stateful services: Require HA mode configured as Active-Standby
Stateless services: Require HA mode configured as Active-Active

You can create different NAT rules:
• Source NAT (SNAT) translates the source IP of the outbound packets to a known public IP address so that the application can communicate with the outside world without using its private IP address. SNAT also tracks the reply.
• Destination NAT (DNAT) enables access to internal private IP addresses from the outside world by translating the destination IP address when inbound communication is initiated. DNAT also takes care of the reply. For both SNAT and DNAT, users can apply NAT rules based on the 5-tuple match criteria.
• Reflexive NAT rules are stateless access control lists (ACLs) that must be defined in both directions. These rules do not track the connection. Reflexive NAT rules are applied when stateful NAT cannot be used. For example, when a Tier-0 gateway is running in active-active equal-cost multipath (ECMP) mode, you cannot configure stateful NAT because asymmetrical paths might cause issues.

Selected Answer: CE
A,B and D are wrong so only C and E remains (reflexive is stateless and stateful is only supported in A/S)

comments.content: Actually, meant to note: C & E

discussion.content:
Stateful services can’t be in active/active, they need to be in Active/Standby. SNAT and DNAT work with stateful services. Reflexive NAT works with stateless. NAT is applied to a logical switch, not an uplink.
http://www.vexpertconsultancy.com/2019/12/nsx-t-configure-network-address-translation-nat/
Correct Answers are A and E. Tier-0 gateways can run in active/active mode while Tier-1 gateway run DNAT and thus in active/standby mode.

D is the correct answer.

The first two are not correct. And C talks about placing the three Manager nodes on the same ESXi host and this would generate a single point of failure so it is also ruled out. On the other hand, the D makes more sense in a cluster of 4 ESXi.

Selected Answer: D
Mitigate Single Point of Failure

choices.A: NSX Controllers are separated from NSX Managers allowing 6 ESXi servers to host them.
choices.D: Single point of failure on Control Plane and Management Plane will be mitigated.
choices.B: NSX Management Plane and Control Plane will be reduced to a single point of failure.
choices.C: Compute consumption guarantees NSX Manager nodes can be run on the same ESXi host.

questions.question_text: What is a design justification for a solution with 3 NSX Manager nodes deployed in a 4 ESXi cluster Management Cluster? (Choose the best answer.)

An architect is helping an organization with the Conceptual Design of an NSX-T Data Center solution.
Which three selections are requirements documented by an architect? (Choose three.)

choices.F: The Development Team are heavy on API usage.
choices.B: All traffic should recover in the event of Host/Rack/ToR failure.
choices.A: Aggregate N-S throughput at any given time should be at least 10G.
choices.E: Business critical applications should have an SLA of 99.99%.
choices.D: SAN storage has enough capacity to build the new infrastructure.
choices.C: Hardware is 5 years old and new hardware is already purchased.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: ABE
ABE are correct answers all these are requirements.
Others are constrains or informations
